intro: Uragoga subintegra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Uragoga subintegra is known for its ability to bloom continuously throughout the year under proper care.
